course_title: Diagnostics and Clinical Reasoning: Adult/Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner
class_notes: Online with specific synchronous sessions. Dates: TBD On-campus Intensives: TBD
course_description: This course is designed to develop assessment and clinical reasoning skills along with application and analysis of evidenced-based theory to deliver care to the adult gerontology population that promotes optimal health and quality of life.
prerequisites: NRSG 544D or equivalent transfer credit as co-requisite. Students must enroll in NRSG 544D first.
sections: Class Nbr: 6391, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ONLIN, Meets: W 10a-12:50p, Instructor: P. Davis, Status: Open
